titles.ar: باب فَضْلِ شِرَاءِ الْحِنْطَةِ وَ الطَّعَامِ
titles.en: Chapter 66 – The merits of buying the wheat and the foodstuffs

titles.ar: باب كَرَاهَةِ الْجِزَافِ وَ فَضْلِ الْمُكَايَلَةِ
titles.en: Chapter 67 – Abhorrence of the thing of unknown measurement or weight, and preference of the measurement

titles.ar: باب فَضْلِ شِرَاءِ الْحِنْطَةِ وَ الطَّعَامِ
titles.en: Chapter 66 – The merits of buying the wheat and the foodstuffs

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (9/157)

narrator_chain.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ ابْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ نَصْرِ بْنِ إِسْحَاقَ الْكُوفِيِّ عَنْ عَبَّادِ بْنِ حَبِيبٍ قَالَ

text: سَمِعْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) يَقُولُ شِرَاءُ الْحِنْطَةِ يَنْفِي الْفَقْرَ وَ  شِرَاءُ الدَّقِيقِ يُنْشِئُ الْفَقْرَ وَ شِرَاءُ الْخُبْزِ مَحْقٌ قَالَ قُلْتُ لَهُ أَبْقَاكَ اللَّهُ فَمَنْ لَمْ يَقْدِرْ عَلَى شِرَاءِ الْحِنْطَةِ قَالَ ذَاكَ لِمَنْ يَقْدِرُ وَ لَا يَفْعَلُ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ibn Mahboub, from Nasr Bin Is’haq Al Kufy, from Abbad Bin Habeeb who said,

‘I heard Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> saying: ‘Buying the wheat  negates the poverty, and buying the flour initiates the poverty, and buying the bread is annihilation (of the wealth)’. I said to him<sup>asws</sup>, ‘May Allah<sup>saww</sup> Make you<sup>asws</sup> to remain! So (what about) the one who is unable upon buying the wheat?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘That is for the one who is able, but does not do it’.
en.sarwar: 1. A number of our people have narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from ibn Mahbub from Nasr ibn Ishaq al-Kufiy from ‘Abbad ibn Habib who has said the following: “I heard abu ‘ Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, saying, ’Buying wheat removes poverty but buying flour brings poverty and buying bread is destruction.’ I (the narrator) then asked, ‘I pray to Allah to grant you long life, what about one who is not able to buy wheat?’ He (the Imam) replied, ’That is for one who is capable but does not do so.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (19/158)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ سَلَمَةَ بْنِ الْخَطَّابِ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْمُنْذِرِ الزَّبَّالِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْفُضَيْلِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: إِذَا كَانَ عِنْدَكَ دِرْهَمٌ فَاشْتَرِ بِهِ الْحِنْطَةَ فَإِنَّ الْمَحْقَ فِي الدَّقِيقِ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Salma Bin Al Khattab, from Ali Bin Al Munzir Al Zayyad, from Muhammad Bin Al Fuzayl,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Whenever there was a Dirham with you, so buy the wheat with it, for the annihilation is in the flour’.
en.sarwar: 2. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Salmah ibn al-Khattab from Ali ibn al-Mundhir al-Zabbal from Muhammad ibn Fudayl who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘If you have one dirham buy wheat with it; buying flour is destruction.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (9/158)

narrator_chain.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ خَالِدٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَلِيٍّ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ جَبَلَةَ عَنْ أَبِي الصَّبَّاحِ الْكِنَانِيِّ قَالَ

text: قَالَ لِي أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) يَا أَبَا الصَّبَّاحِ شِرَاءُ الدَّقِيقِ ذُلٌّ وَ شِرَاءُ الْحِنْطَةِ عِزٌّ وَ شِرَاءُ الْخُبْزِ فَقْرٌ فَنَعُوذُ بِاللَّهِ مِنَ الْفَقْرِ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Khalid, from Muhammad Bin Ali, from Abdullah Bin Jabala, from Abu Al Sabbah Al Kinany who said,

‘Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> said to me: ‘O Abu Al Sabbah! Buying the flour is a disgrace, and buying the wheat is an honour, and buying the bread is poverty. We<sup>asws</sup> seek Refuge with Allah<sup>saww</sup> from the poverty’.
en.sarwar: 3. A number of our people have narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Khalid from Muhammad ibn Ali from ‘Abd Allah ibn Jabalah from abu al-Sabbah al-Kinaniy who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, once said to me, ‘O abu al-Sabbah, buying flour is humiliation, buying wheat is honor and buying bread is poverty; we seek protection with Allah against poverty.’”
